name: "Mr. Griffin Goes to Washington" Online Trivia | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: What baseball team do the Griffins root for at the game?
questions.explanation:
Boston.

	Peter takes the kids out of school to see a baseball game at Fenway Park.  Lois doesn't like the idea that Peter is taking the day off work.

questions.text: How many years has Happy-Go-Lucky Toys been in operation?
questions.explanation:
Twenty-Three.

	Finally, after twenty-three years, the company has been bought out be a conglomerate, and Mr. Weed is forced to leave.

questions.text: What is the name of the cigarette company that takes over Happy-Go-Lucky Toys?
questions.explanation:
El Dorado & El Dorado Cigarettes.

	El Dorado makes the workers have more fun at their job, and they create toys that appeal to kids, but subliminally make them want to smoke the cigarettes.

questions.text: What TV show used to use subliminal messages to get children to start smoking?
questions.explanation:
Lassie.

	Although it's obviously untrue, the dialog of "Lassie" was interrupted by a man who told kids to smoke.  Brian says that subliminal advertising corrupted a whole generation of Americans.

questions.text: Who does the cigarette company send to the Griffins to help with the housework?
questions.explanation:
Martha Stewart.

	Lois says that she takes back all of the mean things that she said about Martha Stewart, and that she's grateful that she's helping.

questions.text: When Peter becomes president of the company, he gets his own office.
questions.explanation:
True.

	As a matter of fact, Peter gets Mr. Weed's old office.  Peter seems to get nothing done in his office, but the company sends him to Washington D.C. instead.

questions.text: What politician does not appear in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Dick Cheney.

	Peter goes to Washington to make sure that an anti-smoking bill doesn't pass, so he persuades the politicians to change their minds.

questions.text: Who is shown smoking in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Stewie.

	Stewie finally started smoking after watching subliminal messages and advertisements that Peter's company ran in all of their merchandise.

questions.text: What does Peter send everyone a message about at the end of the show?
questions.explanation:
Killing Strippers.

	Peter gives a short lecture about the wrongness of killing strippers before the episode ends.  During the episode, a politician kills a stripper, and using that fact, Peter persuades the politicians to assist him in banning the anti-smoking bill.

questions.text: Who tries to quit smoking during the episode?
questions.explanation:
Brian.

	Brian, who is an avid smoker, decides to quit smoking when Peter becomes president of the company, but he begins smoking again after he gets too testy from the lack of nicotine.
